question: Kenneth goes to the store to buy some tea. The normal brand of tea he buys costs $10 per kilogram. He had to buy a more expensive brand that costs 10% more since his favorite brand was sold out. He decides to buy a week's worth of tea and he uses 1 kilogram of tea per day. He also decided to buy himself a cookie for $5. How much did everything cost?
answer:
The tea he bought was 10*0.1=$<<10*0.1=1>>1 more expensive per kilogram than what he normally buys
So it cost 10+1=$<<10+1=11>>11 per kilogram
He goes through 1*7=<<1*7=7>>7 kilograms of tea a week
So he paid 11*7=$<<11*7=77>>77 on tea
That means his total bill was 77+5=$<<77+5=82>>82
#### 82
